subject: RE: [junit] What's going on with TestSuite?
msgSnippet: If I well understood your problem, then you can add this in the code of your suite : public static Test suite () { return new AllSuite(); } In that code, the
messageBody:
If I well understood your problem, then
you can add this in the code of your suite :

public static Test suite ()
{
return new AllSuite();
}

In that code, the name of my class (which extends TestSUite) is AllSuite

Gui


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Berin Loritsch [mailto:bloritsch@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, October 10, 2001 9:26 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] What's going on with TestSuite?
>
>
> Vladimir Bossicard wrote:
> >
> > > I am--the problem is the TestCollector won't even load
> the class if there
> > > is no "test" methods in the class!
> >
> > I see your point: we are talking about two different things...
> >
> > - a TestCollector recursively explores a directory and
> returns all files that match a given pattern. For example
> all files that have a "Test" in their names.
> > - a TestCase is only executed if it has at least one
> "test..." method (otherwise a warning is raised)
> >
> > The TestCollector doesn't parse the file to see if it has a
> "test" method. At least no TestCollector found in the
> official release.
> >
> > To summarize:
> > - your TestCase must implement at least one method
> beginning with "test"
> > - in order to use the standard TestCollector (but you can
> write your own) your TestCase must contain "Test" in its name
>
>
> Now we have deviated from the original topic. I have a
> _TestSuite_ that is not
> being executed as a test suite. It is included with a number
> of other tests,
> gathered by Ant's junit task. Currently, I am trying to run
> it through the
> junit.swingui.TestRunner class--but it also is treating my
> TestSUITE as a TestCase.
> That is not cool. If I take the time to write a TestSuite, I
> want it to be run
> as a suite--not a case.
>
